author: Justin Barry
title: Mets prepare for season opener against Astros with $38M surprise pitcher Clay Holmes leading a lineup of stars and rising talents ready to shine
text:
Season Opener Overview
The team is set to field its presumed starting lineup for the season opener against the Astros, beginning Wednesday night in West Palm Beach at 6:05 p.m. Despite various injury challenges, the roster boasts one of the league’s most formidable batting orders, with established stars and promising young talents ready to make an impact. With Opening Day just over a week away, the lineup is designed to build chemical rapport ahead of regular season play.
Batting Lineup Composition
The top half of the lineup is anchored by a trio of dynamic players, with one star batter leading off and another in the second spot followed by a lineup anchored by a powerful hitter in the third position. The cleanup role is expected to be shared by two players, their placement contingent on the opposing pitcher. One of these players, returning from a knee injury, will see action in right field, while a veteran with a reduced role steps in at designated hitter when needed. Infield adjustments have been made as well; a young player currently excelling at the plate will take over second base duties in the absence of an injured veteran, with another promising infielder further solidifying the roster in a utility role.
Pitching Decisions and Surprises
While the batting core retains its stability, a notable departure in the pitching rotation involves the matchup scheduled for Wednesday night. Although the game features one pitcher on the mound, a surprise performance during spring training has earned a new addition a prominent role in the rotation. The unexpected starter, who signed a multi-year deal following a tenure with another team, is a two-time All-Star. Despite limited starting experience over his career, his performance in spring practice has instilled confidence in the coaching staff, setting the stage for his appearance on March 27th.
Depth, Resilience, and Future Impact
This lineup represents a balance of experience and youth, with seasoned hitters leading off and young talents eager to establish themselves. The configuration not only addresses immediate goals against a formidable opponent but also provides insights into how the team will navigate the season. The blend of strategic defensive placements and robust offensive capabilities, combined with promising pitching prospects, paints an encouraging picture as the season approaches. Every component of the roster is positioned to adapt and thrive, making the upcoming contest a critical stepping stone in shaping the team’s identity for the long haul.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in St. Charles Parish history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in St. Charles Parish, Louisiana from 1901-2000 was 54.6. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did St. Charles Parish, Louisiana experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in St. Charles Parish, Louisiana history.

author: Pedro Gil
title: Taxa de desemprego no país cai para 7,5% e atinge o menor nível desde 2015 | VEJA
text:
A taxa de desemprego no Brasil caiu para 7,5% no trimestre terminado em novembro, segundo a Pesquisa Nacional por Amostra de Domicílios (PNAD) Contínua, divulgada nesta sexta-feira, 29, pelo Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística (IBGE). Trata-se da menor taxa para um trimestre desde fevereiro de 2015. No trimestre anterior, de junho a agosto, o índice ficou em 7,8%. No mesmo período em 2022, era de 8,1%. É a terceira queda consecutiva da taxa de desemprego, e a menor para um trimestre encerrado em novembro desde 2014.
Em números absolutos, são 8,2 milhões de pessoas desocupadas. No trimestre, entre as pessoas ocupadas, houve crescimento de 0,9%, que chegou ao recorde de 100,5 milhões de pessoas, maior número da série histórica iniciada em 2012. No ano, o aumento foi de 0,8%, com mais 815 mil pessoas ocupadas. A soma de ocupados e desocupados teve alta de 0,6% no trimestre, estimado em 108,7 milhões. A população fora da força totalizou 66,5 milhões.
O número de empregados com carteira de trabalho no setor privado foi de 37,7 milhões, com alta de 1,4% (mais 515 mil) no trimestre e de 2,5% (mais 935 mil) no ano. Foi o segundo maior contingente desde o início da série histórica da pesquisa, em 2012, atrás apenas de junho de 2014 (37,8 milhões). Já o número de empregados sem carteira no setor privado (13,4 milhões) foi o maior da série, apesar de ficar estável no trimestre e no ano. O número de trabalhadores por conta própria (25,6 milhões de pessoas) também ficou estável frente ao trimestre anterior e ao mesmo período do ano passado, assim como o número de trabalhadores domésticos (5,9 milhões de pessoas).
A taxa de informalidade foi de 39,2% da população ocupada (ou 39,4 milhões de trabalhadores informais) contra 39,1% no trimestre anterior e 38,9% no mesmo trimestre de 2022.
